text:
By Steve Shannon ,
1 hours ago
Illinois just scored some national recognition, landing in the Top 5 of a new WalletHub ranking. Out of all 50 states and the District of Columbia, only a handful rose to the top, and Illinois proudly joined their ranks.
Illinois Ranks #5 in the Nation Getty Images Download the WZOK Mobile App Now WalletHubâ€™s 2025 report placed Illinois in the fifth spot overall, right behind Virginia, Utah, Washington, and New York. Thatâ€™s not just a random list, it represents the states doing the best job of supporting a profession that touches nearly every family in America.
Why Illinois Earned Its Spot The study analyzed 24 key factors, including pay growth potential, turnover rates, school-system quality, and state spending per student. Illinois excelled in several of these areas, creating stability and opportunity that many other states struggle to match. Itâ€™s not about flashy perks, itâ€™s about making sure the people in this role can actually thrive.
Revealing the Profession Canva So, which job is it that Illinois does so well supporting? Teaching . WalletHubâ€™s data shows Illinois is one of the best states in the nation for teachers in 2025. Considering the pressures educators face, this recognition is significant; it shows Illinois is investing in both its classrooms and its future.

The Bigger Picture for Education On the flip side, states like South Dakota, New Hampshire, Maine, Montana, and Hawaii landed at the bottom of the list. That contrast is a reminder of how different the experience can be depending on where a teacher works, and why Illinoisâ€™ Top 5 spot truly matters.
To every Illinois teacher: thank you for showing up, day after day, to shape the future.
